name: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality set in the 1930s.

name: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about the future, depicting a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

name: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the young wizard and his adventures at Hogwarts.

name: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Hobbit
description: A prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins on a journey filled with magic and danger.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby
description: A story about the American dream and the disillusionment that comes with it, set in the 1920s.

name: Mary Shelley
title: Frankenstein
description: A Gothic novel about a scientist who creates a sentient being, exploring themes of ambition and isolation.

name: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that also critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

name: Mark Twain
title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: A novel about the adventures of a young boy and a runaway slave as they travel down the Mississippi River.

name: Herman Melville
title: Moby-Dick
description: An epic tale of the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, led by Captain Ahab who is intent on finding the white whale Moby-Dick.

title: War and Peace
